bibl.title: Regional and Interregional Exchanges in the Eastern Mediterranean during the Early Byzantine Period. The Evidence of Amphorae.
bibl.note: Paper delivered at the Spring Symposium held at Dumbarton Oaks, 2-4 May 2008. - Amphorae: attesting to the dynamism of the East. - The transport of goods by amphora: a lucrative trade. - Exchanges: means and agents [see in part. pp. 41-42: painted inscriptions on Late Roman amphorae from Egypt]. - The standardization of amphorae: a difficult question. - The structures of production: complexity of methods and premises. - Imitations and forgeries.
bibl.seg: Dominique Pieri, Regional and Interregional Exchanges in the Eastern Mediterranean during the Early Byzantine Period. The Evidence of Amphorae.
Cécile Morrisson (ed.), Trade and Markets in Byzantium = Dumbarton Oaks Byzantine Symposia and Colloquia (Washington, D.C., 2012) pp. 27-49, 1 tabl., 14 figg. n./bl. et coul.

Paper delivered at the Spring Symposium held at Dumbarton Oaks, 2-4 May 2008. - Amphorae: attesting to the dynamism of the East. - The transport of goods by amphora: a lucrative trade. - Exchanges: means and agents [see in part. pp. 41-42: painted inscriptions on Late Roman amphorae from Egypt]. - The standardization of amphorae: a difficult question. - The structures of production: complexity of methods and premises. - Imitations and forgeries.
